title: Turtleboy movie, docuseries in the works, production company says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Entertainment Aidan Kearney shot to national prominence for his coverage of the Karen Read murder case.
The blogger known as "Turtleboy" was jubilant as he emerged from the courthouse after the verdict in the Karen Read retrial.

Lane Turner / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin January 21, 2026 | 12:45 PM 2 minutes to read Turtleboy blogger and “Free Karen Read” champion Aidan Kearney is making the leap from livestreams to the big screen, with a docuseries in production and a feature film reportedly on the way.

title: Matt Damon explains to Joe Rogan why Netflix now makes movies for people with zero attention span
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Matt Damon told Joe Rogan that Netflix executives ask screenwriters to create excitement in "the first five minutes" of a movie and to have characters reiterate the plot "three or four times" for people looking at their phones.
Matt Damon and Ben Affleck during their appearance on "Casuals with Katie Nolan.

" Cindy Ord/Getty Images for SiriusXM By Kevin Slane January 21, 2026 | 12:25 PM 2 minutes to read Despite successfully partnering with Netflix for their new movie, “The Rip,” Matt Damon and Ben Affleck aren’t afraid to criticize the streaming giant.

title: Genealogists release image in attempt to identify child’s skull found in N.H. store in the 1990s
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Local News Investigators say the remains, seized from a Seabrook tattoo shop in 1994, likely belonged to a young girl with ancestral ties to Greece.
The DNA Doe Project released a new facial reconstruction on Monday in attempt to identify the girl whose skull was found in a Seabrook N.
H.

title: Life lately: The best of Celtics tunnel fashion in January 2026
author: LaDonna LaGuerre
bullets: Boston Celtics A midseason look at NBA fashion in Boston and beyond.
Halfway through the season, the weather has settled in and the Celtics runway has shifted into winter mode.
January brought heavier fabrics, bigger textures, layered looks, and the occasional flex.

title: Local obituary: Ella Johnson, 21, Washington University in St. Louis senior from Belmont
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Local Obituaries "Ella was, above all else, deeply loved—and deeply loving.

title: Segun Idowu, prominent economic leader in Wu administration, is stepping down
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Idowu, a key figure in City Hall, said that he is resigning to care for his aging grandmother.
Boston’s Chief of Economic Opportunity and Inclusion Segun Idowu will step down at the end of February.
Jessica Rinaldi/Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: A Beverly father’s Boston Marathon run is rooted in his son’s cancer fight — and a miracle next door
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Boston Marathon "They carried us emotionally while delivering precise, extraordinary medical care.
When we were in a very dark place, they kept the stars switched on, and drove us forward.
" John Connolly is running the 2026 Boston Marathon.

title: JetBlue has increased flights to meet the needs of Patriots fans this weekend
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Flights “Pats fans travel with passion, and we’re proud to help bring that energy to this pivotal game.
” The side of a JetBlue plane at Logan Airport.

Stephan Savoia By Kristi Palma January 21, 2026 | 11:18 AM 1 minute to read Due to “overwhelming demand” from New England Patriots fans, JetBlue has increased service out of Boston for the AFC Championship game in Denver on Sunday.

title: How to make 2026 your best book year yet
author: Zipporah Osei
bullets: Books Get advice from local booksellers and experts to reboot your personal reading goals.

title: See the 2026 James Beard semifinalists of New England
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News Every New England state was represented across the 14 James Beard Award categories.
